Class CAADie

  • java.lang.Object
    • Die
      • CAADie

  • public class CAADie
extends Die

    Crown and Anchor Die

    The CAADie class is designed to be used in specifically Crown and Anchor, which extends the basic die class. The class will map a number value from the basic class to a symbol and checks the result.
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Euan Wilkinson, ID S5083285
    See Also:
    Die

    • Method Detail

      • translateNumber

        public java.lang.String translateNumber()
        Maps a number value to a string which is associated with an image elsewhere using a switch statment.
        Returns:
        String this returns a string value representing a symbol

      • checkResult

        public boolean checkResult(int[] betArray)
        Checks the result of the die roll based on whether the player bet on the symbol which was rolled. Uses a switch statement to detect the die's result and check for a bet placed on that result. It then uses a boolean flag to indicate whether a bet was placed on that symbol or not.
        Parameters:
        betArray - the array of bets from the game
        Returns:
        boolean this returns a boolean value which determines whether or not the bet placed was correct

      • isBetCorrect

        public boolean isBetCorrect()
        Getter for whether or not the bet was correct.
        Returns:
        boolean returns whether the bet was correct

      • setBetCorrect

        public void setBetCorrect(boolean betCorrect)
        Setter for whether or not the bet is correct.
        Parameters:
        betCorrect - the flag for whether or not the bet placed was correct
